name: Sunnah.com - Hadith Database
description: The largest online collection of authentic hadith (prophetic traditions). Contains the six major hadith collections (Kutub al-Sittah) plus additional compilations. Each hadith includes Arabic text, English translation, and scholarly grading.

categories.name: Sahih al-Bukhari
categories.description: Most authentic hadith collection, compiled by Imam al-Bukhari (810-870 CE). Contains 7,275 hadith.

categories.name: Sahih Muslim
categories.description: Second most authentic collection, compiled by Imam Muslim (815-875 CE). Contains 7,563 hadith.

categories.name: Jami at-Tirmidhi
categories.description: Collection by Imam at-Tirmidhi (824-892 CE). Known for including hadith grades.

categories.name: Sunan Abu Dawud
categories.description: Collection focused on legal hadith, by Imam Abu Dawud (817-889 CE).

categories.name: Sunan an-Nasai
categories.description: Collection by Imam an-Nasai (829-915 CE), known for strict criteria.

categories.name: Sunan Ibn Majah
categories.description: Collection by Imam Ibn Majah (824-887 CE).

categories.name: Muwatta Malik
categories.description: Earliest written collection by Imam Malik (711-795 CE).

categories.name: 40 Hadith Nawawi
categories.description: 40 foundational hadith selected by Imam an-Nawawi.

categories.name: Riyad as-Salihin
categories.description: Collection of hadith on ethics and manners by Imam an-Nawawi.

search.searchTips: Search in English or Arabic. Use collection names (bukhari, muslim) to filter. Hadith numbers work directly (e.g., 'bukhari:1').

contentPage.description: Content pages are individual hadith, identified by collection:number format (e.g., bukhari:1) or collection/book/hadith path.

collection.description: The hadith collection name (e.g., Sahih al-Bukhari)

hadithNumber.description: The hadith number within the collection

arabicText.description: The original Arabic text of the hadith

grade.description: Scholarly authentication grade of the hadith

valueMap.hasan: Good - acceptable but slightly lower than sahih
valueMap.da'if: Weak - has issues in chain or text

narrator.description: The companion who narrated this hadith from the Prophet

extraction.contentNotes: The main content contains the English translation. Arabic text is separate. The narrator line typically starts with 'Narrated [Name]:'. Grades are crucial for authenticity - prioritize sahih and hasan hadith.

aiNotes: Sunnah.com is the most reliable online hadith source. Always include the hadith grade when citing. The format 'collection:number' (e.g., Bukhari:1) is the standard citation format. Sahih al-Bukhari and Sahih Muslim are considered the most authentic collections.
